Something like this would be helpful to me.  Usually I comment out the
test=
 until I remember to fix it.  This way I wouldn't have to remember
to fix i=
t, JUnit would tell me to fix it...

Kris

> Hello All,

> I'm curious how many JUnit users want=
 a way to temporarily 
> mark certain 
> test methods so that the runner do=
esn't execute them, but 
> reports that 
> they are skipped. This is a func=
tionality that Vladimir R. Bossicard

er, which he describes in 
> his first 
> blog post:
> 
http://www.artima.c=
om/weblogs/viewpost.jsp?thread=3D4603

I'm considering whether or not it ma=
kes sense to do something similar 
for SuiteRunner, and I'd like to know wh=
at JUnit users would really 
want. If you do want something like this, for =
what specific use cases 
do you imagine you'd use it?

Thanks.
